intro: Tetrapathaea, commonly known as the four-way plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive four-lobed leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Tetrapathaea species are known for their ornamental value and are sometimes cultivated for their unique foliage. However, some species may contain toxic compounds, requiring caution during handling.
